PET/CT is often used to detect and monitor cancer, as well as to evaluate the effectiveness of cancer treatments.

DCE-MRI (Dynamic Contrast-Enhanced Magnetic Resonance Imaging) is a specialized form of MRI that involves the injection of a contrast agent into the bloodstream. DCE-MRI is often used to evaluate the response to cancer treatments and to monitor the progression of diseases.
